basics.name: Mason Daugherty
basics.label: Student, Bowdoin College
basics.summary: I'm a Texan-turned-Mainer, currently studying Computer Science and Digital & Computational Studies at Bowdoin College, graduating in 2025. I have passion for problem-solving and utilizing effective storytelling to simplify complex ideas.

work.name: Teens to Trails
work.description: Nonprofit connecting Maine teens to the outdoors
work.summary: Nonprofit connecting Maine teens to the outdoors
highlights: Designed and implemented custom JavaScript integrations, automating accounting tasks between Airtable and QuickBooks using their APIs, reducing manual data entry by over six hours weekly

Spearheaded the implementation of Apple Business Essentials for Zero-Touch MDM Deployment for new company machines, automating setup with federated authentication and security-first configuration profiles and apps, reducing setup time by 65%

Leveraged Waterfall & Kanban methodologies to design, implement, and provide ongoing systems training support for an improved cross departmental project planning tool, resulting in a 95% adoption rate

work.name: WBOR 91.1 FM
highlights: Oversee 220+ student & community volunteer DJs & supervise broadcast equipment and facilities
Wrote 32500+ words of documentation (best practices, admin tool guidelines, software maintenance & troubleshooting, recurring processes & procedures) and created adaptable design diagrams

Built and maintained the station’s website. Integrated features such as real-time program schedules, DJ profiles, and automated song logging. Alongside this, deployed and configured a new off-site audio streaming server, increasing listener capacity and reducing downtime by 30%
Compile quarterly reports to be submitted on behalf of Bowdoin College to the Federal Communications Commission
Engage 100% of the 1,100+ recorded WBOR Alumni
Implemented a Twilio-powered “Text the DJ” feature, enabling real-time listener interaction with DJs during live broadcasts. Increased listener engagement, resulting in over 500 texts per week

work.name: Bowdoin College Information Technology
highlights: Led audio-visual tech setup and execution for high-profile events, such as graduation and guest speakers
Partnered with event stakeholders to translate technical requirements, swiftly troubleshooting and resolving technical issues in real-time under pressure
Used TeamDynamix ITSM to generate/maintain detailed ticket records and update documentation
Mentored and trained new technicians alongside the Event Production Coordinator
Improved venue reliability and uptime by implementing rigorous weekly operational equipment checklists

work.name: Northeast Photographic
highlights: Developed mastery in operating Colex and Jobo rotary film processors
Proficiency in C-41, E-6, and B&W chemical processes

work.name: LACORE Enterprises
highlights: Orchestrated comprehensive rebranding initiatives across six corporate entities, encompassing website design, on-site visual content creation, and streamlined online consistency
Strategically aligned brand vision through regular supervisor consultations, culminating in a cohesive online identity
Conducted virtual audits for accreditation bodies such as NSF and ISO (17025), while optimizing internal operations by developing in-house hiring intake forms

volunteer.organization: McKeen Center for the Common Good
volunteer.summary: Led groups of students in community philanthropy at Maine's island communities

volunteer.summary: Interacted with elected officials to discuss current and proposed federal and local policy

highlights: Former Historian and Board Chair
Volunteered in local community philanthropies, including Habitat for Humanity, McKinney Roots, and HUGS Cafe

volunteer.position: World Affairs Council of Dallas/Fort Worth
highlights: Steered a successful marketing initiative that garnered $15,000 in support for a demining campaign in Dimce, Kosovo, with matching contributions from two external parties, including the Princess Diana Foundation
Orchestrated sponsor communication, vendor collaboration, and strategic outreach efforts, resulting in a remarkable 31% surge in club membership through targeted physical advertisements

volunteer.summary: Volunteered in residence at a leading New England farm and apothecary

awards.title: StudentCam Grand Prize Winner
awards.summary: Produced winning documentary and was recognized on the US Congress House Floor by Congressman Van Taylor for helping to engage youth and bring awareness to the powers of citizen accountability in government
